column1: Probably one of the worst Credit Unions i have ever dealt with. I have been trying to serve a subpoena to this institution but they are entitled to ignore court orders. Don't waste your time with Pen Fed.
Bought with dealer financing to get dealer discount, refinanced next day with PENFED for better than dealer interest rate.  Dealer actually suggested doing this!
Need more tools boast available to Puerto Rico also if we can added are bills cel, electric, water, cable credit card and all bills will be nice.

The rates on deposit accounts are above average. Customer service falls incredibly short. Expect to wait 15 mins+ each time you call. I had a credit card charge that was disputed, as the merchant put in writing I would be refunded.   With this in writing PedFed said “There is nothing we can do, and at least it’s only $112 lost.”    Really?  I immediately transferred all accounts $25k out… trust is a major factor of banking and if I can’t trust a small issue to be handled, I can only imagine the maze with larger concerns.

Poor customer service, LOTS of lip service. I signed up for checking, savings & credit card and was approved for all 3. I got an email the next day stating my checking account was opened. 2 days after opening, I suddenly was locked out of all my accounts. I called, they said they needed ID docs. I sent them the same day via uploading and was told by rep they will be reviewed in 24 hrs. 48 hrs later, still locked out. I called again, I was told give them another 48 hrs and it should be unlocked. She also confirmed ID docs were received and were in "final review". She said she would call me back the next day and give me an update. She verified my number and no call was received. 48 hrs went by, still locked out. I called again and spoke with a supervisor Jan. She told me, that my account would be unlocked by the end of the day (It was a Friday) or at the latest Monday. That was yesterday, Today (Tuesday) I am still locked out of all my accounts. I called again today. The rep said she would email the department responsible and either she or they would call me back by the end of the day today. Not surprising, no calls. Not one person out of 4 offered any kind of escalation. I even emailed comments@penfed.org the response I got there was, for me to call in again if it wasn't resolved. I cannot believe how poorly this organization is run and lack of customer service and accountability for lack thereof. 4 calls, 2 emails and 1 week later for an issue that was supposed to be resolved in 24 hrs. Now, this is supposedly a verification issue. I sent them License, ss card and a utility bill, also verified all my info verbally 4 times when I called and they sent my checks to me already. Ridiculous!

Citibank,Chase, Bankrate, Lending Tree, Lending Club, Marcus, OneMain ,Discovery,Prosper,Avant, Best Egg and Upstart just to name a few of the companies where I attempted to secure a personal loan to help me with my debt. I have a good monthly pension and would have little trouble with repayment. In fact, I intend on repayment within 2 years as a show of good faith. PenFed Credit Union was the only company that would help.The stress level and anxiety was epic. The Application process was easy and expeditious. The customer service representatives were polite,  courteous and professional. I had one issue with signing the promissory note which the representative walked me through. I received my check within 3 days! I am eligible for social security next year and plan on having the payments directly deposited into my Penfed account. I am not debt free but I can see my head above water while I formulate a plan. On behalf of my family and I, thank you PenFed from the bottom of my heart. You have a loyal customer for life!

I wish I could negative stars.  I left a previous rating and things have continued to go badly in respect to closing my loan.  I am into month number four and was told today that I would have to wait at least another month.  Most of this due to their inability to communicate at even a low level.  I have been communicating with them primarily via email and they have handled my emails in two ways:  1. Not reading my emails (Maybe they don't understand English) - responding with obtuse questions or comments that were clearly addressed in detail in my previous messages to them. Even the lawyer from the title company did this! 2. Apologizing without acknowledging anything specific that they needed to correct.  Yes, you get a great rate but you will pay for it with having to put up with extraordinary long processing times and people that apparently have no idea how to conduct their business in a timely professional manner.
The loan is 0 balance since may 2021. It’s mean this loan have been sold since may 2021. Please change to 0 balance in my report to improve my score.
A great Credit Union to work with. Very user friendly. Staff are very knowledgeable, professional and friendly. I recommend them to all my friends and associates

The only good thing about our mortgage process with PenFed was the rate. They were significantly lower than other lenders, but we paid for that rate with poor systems and often no communication at all.  Despite the HQ being located in Alexandria, VA our mortgage officer, if you can call her that was located in Texas. During the process emails to her went unresponded, her voicemail was full, and there were often other random people jumping in to respond for her without any context which only added to the confusion as to who to contact. In the end, it didn't matter who we tried to contact as none of them ever answered their phone or responded to emails/voicemails. Along with the lack of communication, they also sent incorrect documents for closing and delayed closing, but we did get a great rate, so 1 star for that.

I wish I could give negative stars.......PenFed used to be one of the best out there but in recent years they have really gone downhill. They no longer have any concern for the member/client, depending on who you speak to you will get a different answer for every issue, their communication and processes are very bad and their senior leaders hide behind their first-line support personnel instead of responding to requests for escalation. I can go on and on, I would recommend using a different lender.
Pre approved me for credit card than denied me waste of time & inquiry. Than gonna tell me I’m pre approved to apply. Bad business. I don’t apply unless I know I’m getting approved smh
Slow reporting to the credit bureaus.  Last viewable report was over a month ago. Account was paid off over thirty days ago. Would appreciate a more rapid  reporting on accounts.

My HELOC application was turned down on my Primary Residence although, it was only to increase my current PENFED HELOC an additional $30k to make home improvements. I was turned down because I had a COVID Forbearance on another investment property because my tenant was evicted. The Forbearance was turned into a modification/refinance and had nothing to do with my Primary Residence or my current HELOC. My Primary, both HELOCs all paid on time, i have a 830+ credit score, $0 unsecured credit and high income and PENFED turned me down because they state they have a blanket policy. Any Forbearance regardless will disqualify you for 12 months. That's very discriminatory!!

Penfed promised lower interest rate if I used car buying service. That’s what they say online and what they said over the phone. Just sign the check they told me and give us the VIN later. Bought a car, Penfed sent paperwork to sign - nope, they didn’t reduce the interest rate. Fraud.
Very easy application process with fast approval review. Reasonable interest rate. No early payoff penalties. Great company to work with.

I have had this credit card for five years.  The credit limit is good and the 2% back with no categories is great!  PenFed has made some much needed updates to their user interfaces and by allowing customers to cash in any amount (no longer limited to increments of $5), but they still have some work to do.  On average over the last five years, it takes 3-5 days to process a payment; just an unacceptable standard for any decade in the 21st century.  On average in the last five years, it takes 25-35 days for fraud resolution, and it is a system of paper, e-mails, and phone calls over that time frame to get a resolution; missing one phone call adds another 5-days.  Every other card I have had, the charge goes away the moment you report the fraud, and all the investigation happens in the background.  Also, if you have someone else on your account, then you must have the same card number.  So, when one of our cards gets lost or the number used for fraud, you have to go without both cards for 5-10 days until new cards get mailed through snail-mail.  The benefits of this card are great, that's why I have kept it for so long.  However, I look about every 6-months to see if anyone else has a comparable program; I am leaving as soon as I find one.  I guess I would stick around if PenFed's system ever completely got out of 1985.

Disaster. Applied in February. Still in limbo. Repeated requests for same documents. One person is rescuing me. Appraisal $850! Wasn't informed about this cost up front. Misinformation from loan officer every step. Was told appraisal amount that was 30 percent lower than appraiser had estimated. Repeatedly requests for appraisal report I paid for despite Dodd-Frank requirement appraisal should be given promptly. Last two mortgages a mess. Last one: settlement figures were all wrong and had to be redone. I have top credit, paid mortgages ahead of time, never delinquent.

Thanks PenFed for screwing me over.   Out of nowhere I get a call asking why I closed my CC account from the lender I’m do the refinance through and I said what are you talking about I haven’t closed any accounts. Well come to find out PenFed decided to close my account because the card hasn’t been used in over a year. When I called them asking what gives they said it was hasn't been used for over a year so they closed it. I said isn’t that called having credit?????  Again thanks for screwing my over.
Good company to work with. Report flawlessly: They offer great finance rates. They make everything simple. Never had any issues. Highly recommended

I have had a number of different loans through PenFed and all have been great. I have been in the process of getting an auto loan and was sent a draft check. Wrote the check amount for what I was approved plus GAP (because it was indicated I could do so on the check) and they bounced the check at the dealership- humiliatingly. I was told a new bank check would be sent to me, it was never sent. I was then told a new draft check would be sent last night, and called today to find yet again it was not sent. FINALLY someone was able to help and send out a new check today and overnighted it. This has been such a terrible experience and I am so mortified.

They will cancel your card out of nowhere!!! Beware if they do this it will hurt your credit score. I have one late payment on a different card and since the other card put delinquent on an account, this caused Pentagon FCU to cancel my credit card which had nothing to do with one late payment. I had a credit line the FCU made me pay up all the money on credit card once closed. I was stranded in a different state as I was not notified of any issue until I kept getting decline randomly. If you want a respectable organization that won't cancel on you and works with you then don't choose FCU. go with USAA or NFCU instead. Not worth the hassle on the phone and having to deal with the issue for 8 months before everything resolved.

The WORST customer service EVER. They speak as if you are truly bothering them about YOUR money. I spoke with one agent that actually made me feel as if I was important. They hold your funds for a week, yes, banks do hold your funds, but start releasing funds to you daily, seriously. They don't care if you have bills to pay, They will ask you to upload all of these documents, and when you send the documents, your funds are still on hold. Unacceptable. I'll go back to NFCU for my checking , and just deal with Pen for my savings. LATER
Great Customer Service. Always following up. They pull from Equifax just a FYI. I believe FICO 5 and 9 Auto. Thinking about doing a mortgage with them in about year.

AVOID. They had great rates, quick pre-approval, and  low closing costs, but I guess you get what you pay for (in a bad way). There were mistakes throughout the process. And, how would you like to get your closing disclosure only 4 hours before Closing to discover the Loan Amount agreed has been LOWERED (by mistake), your lender credits aren't what were agreed to and you are also paying double for your homeowners insurance because they are charging you even though you already paid and confirmed PenFed had the documentation requested already. Because we couldn't delay closing and it would take too long to fix their mistakes, we had to find a way to bring thousands of dollars extra to the closing table with a couple hours notice...and then spend months trying to resolve (not the loan amount, because too late for that, but months for the other pieces). Communication was terrible and mistakes were made throughout, but closing day was the icing on this mess of a cake. My realtor and attorney both thought PenFed was difficult/unusual. And a separate PenFed employee reviewed my case after the fact and said things like: that should never have happened, what they told you was incorrect, I will make a note that they need training, that's unacceptable.  If you use them, stay on them like a hawk - you'll need to earn those low closing costs. And if you talk about anything on the phone make them email you anything they say that's important, while you are ON the phone.

This is the most discourteous, insulting institution that ever existed !! Its computer phone system is designed to frustrate, no, actually enrage, any customer having the misfortune to call. When personal calls are made, the employees actually pick up the phone, sometimes say "Hello," but then disconnect the call so they don't have to do anything. Alternatively, they answer and leave you on hold forever, or transfer you back to Square One, where you have to again go through the same series of prompts, over and over again, even after you complain about the abominable treatment you keep being subjected to. If you do ever get through to a human and announce that you've been treated awfully, they politely ask you the nature of your problem, claim they're going to transfer you to someone to handle it, and then promptly set you back to Square One !! How does the government allow this dump to be in the banking business ???
If you can apply get it. High credit limits and accepted pretty much anywhere. No annual fee. Low APR. Good stuff all around. Yeap really really good ain't kidding you.

Application process was easy. Customer Representative made it painless and walked through the process step by step and what will occur afterwards. Approval came through while we were updating my information with them. A+++

Was a pleasure talking with them because web app had some problems and kept discarding the application. They handled it very promptly by apologizing and offered to complete application over phone. The Approval was quick and I received the card in a couple days.

Terrible service had to go back and forth with them getting the documents they needed! Once I got them the documents I was expecting the card to get mailed to me but then I received and email telling me that my application had expired. I called them and after waiting for 20min I explain the situation to the person he just tells me I have to reapply didn't give no other explanation sounded like he didn't even care. So I asked him if I reapplied would it affect my credit score again he said yes. Once again terrible service really doesn't show they care about their customers!

PenFed made setting up the Secure Share Loan easy, deposit money, let it age for 30 days, call a representative and initiate the loan.  Once initiated, paying over the required minimum payment pushes the next payment due date out into the future.

First opened the account because their saving's rate was one of the highest, but now that no one has any decent rate decided to close it. Their bad side, and is a BIG one is their on-line sinning which is one of the worst for on line banking or savings, sometimes taking several minutes to actually get into you account. It is actually like safe-cracking a vault.

Don't like that they don't give you the option to have cash sent to savings. My biggest concern is that the card only provides rewards for gas. Not other areas. When I applied it was 5 gas, 2 groceries and 1 everything else.  They have a proclivity to change at will. Everything had changed.

I feel that it’s my professional duty to leave this review and inform the public about Penfed lending practices, since I am a professional, full time realtor. As a realtor, I have worked with many lenders of the buyers that I represented, and so I have a ton of experience with various lending institutions. Here is how Penfed compares to other lending institutions that I worked with in past: Usually when I contacted a lender on behalf of my buyers, they responded within 24 hours. Mostly they responded during the same business day, within 1-3 hours. With PenFed - they just don’t respond. They don’t. If you are sitting and waiting for them to respond, you will miss your closing date. I remember a week before our closing I received an email from my Escrow officer: “I have not heard from your lender and I have emailed the processor twice.” With other lending institutions that I worked with, there was a team that would work together to get the file to closing. A loan officer, loan processor, underwrites, closer, all the team members came together, and each did their part in the process. They also communicated with each other to resolve issues. With Penfed... (quoting my partner) “it was like ordering a food in a fast food restaurant that is run by inexperienced teenagers. Although, teenagers actually try to learn from their mistakes and improve. PenFed doesn’t.” Every Penfed employee that we encountered in the process did not do their job right. (with one exception of a manager who magically made things work in the last moment, after I wrote them that if the sale doesn’t close on time, I will go public to the news outlets) I needed to educate (no kidding) the loan processor that it was her job to make sure that the appraisal is scheduled and happening. Every time that she told me that she will figure something out and call back, she didn’t. Finally, I just told her that she is a liar, and I don’t trust her at all. The underwriters... After the first review, their underwriters counted my investment property, which has been a rental for that past 10 years, against my credit. (as if I was paying mortgage on it but wasn’t getting rent) After complaining to their management that this was against lending rules and regulations, this was corrected. With their second review, there was the following request: “Provide a letter from CPA stating the withdrawal of funds for this transaction will not have a negative impact on the business.” My accountant was stunned when I communicated this to her. She said that this was against CPA regulations of not attesting to the future of any business and that no CPA firm would take that risk of losing their license and providing a statement that violates CPA codes and regulations. 2 days before closing, with their third review, the underwriting requested a home owners insurance policy for HOA and HOA documents. column1: PenFed is very slow to post payments which is concerning as I do not like having a balance reported on my credit report... Example, I made a $2500 payment took about 3 days for ACH withdrawal from my checking... A full 7 days later and my $2500 payment is not reflected in my balance owed - this is unacceptable in 2021... my other credit card providers do a way better job with posting payments appropriately... Definitely putting this card in my sock drawer.

If I could give zero stars i would!! This company is a rip off!!I have insurance on my car, but they are still charging me for their insurance as well. I'm not sure how this is fair in any way, shape or form. If you're looking for a company who does right by their customers, don't come here.
Love the company. Fair intelligent answers to all of my questions. Fair rates and less corporate hassle. .  Professional staff. Easy to use app. Less confusion.
They do not honor their fraud policy. They are difficult to work with.  Many years and I felt like a stranger with them. Very rude employees.

In January 2021 I reopened a PFCU account, hoping its customer service had improved. Boy, what a mistake! For 2 months I couldn't access my account, always receiving a system is down response. I filed several online assistance requests and got the standard we're sorry we're working the problem automated response. I then started calling PFCU, spending hours and hours on the phone trying to resolve the issue, with no luck. Then one day, tired and totally frustrated, I told a customer service rep how bad PFCU's customer service was and that I had left PFCU years back due to its declining service. She then put me on ignore for 15 minutes and came back and said that I was not able to log in because I was using the same username (with a different password) that I had used 10 years ago. So, I changed it and bingo, that problem was solved. Why this wasn't resolved the first time I called is beyond me... After obtaining a car loan, it took PFCU over 3 weeks to send me a check, though my loan had been approved within 15 minutes. I reviewed my phone records and in 3 weeks I spent over 8 hours on the phone with PFCU trying to resolve the matter! Finally, a supervisor got involved and he quickly fixed an internal PFCU processing problem and within 24 hours I had the check in hand... In early April PFCU claimed that it had never received my signatory card, but my photocopy records indicate I mailed it to PFCU in January. So now I've got to download and prepare and send them another one. Yesterday I received a notice from PFCU that they hadn't received my car documents (liens, title application, etc), which I sent them on March 13th. So I reviewed my records, which have photocopies of all the documents which I sent them back on March 13th, to include my state title application signed and dated by my town tax agent. I had kept the owner's copy and sent PFCU the lienholders copy and the town tax agent kept the original. So I then emailed PFCU at the address given on the letter they sent me, attaching a scan of my owner's document. Within 10 minutes I then received an automated email reply back from PFCU saying that I can't use the email address they provided me because it will not accept attachments and that I have to use another method.. I tried looking up the address of the PFCU CEO so I could write her/him regarding all of the above, but of course that information was conveniently not available, other than to say he was James Schenck, a West point grad who later attended harvard. Well, Mr. Schenck, my advice to you is to put your boots back on and come down from your lofty perch and hit the trenches answering some of your member's phone calls sometimes and hear straight from them just how bad your customer service is and how poorly your departments are performing! If I could give PFCU zero stars I would. If a PFCU representative responds to this comment, please provide me with Mr. Schenck's contact info, as he needs to be informed that

column1: My only and best experience with credit unions. Best rates both on loans and savings.. Glad I learned about them.. Limited branches but no need with today's electronic world.
thank you for the opportunity to have account and proceed in life. now I can get back to making money. I will be ok to take these next steps
Great credit union to bank with for cars, mortgage, credit cards the interests are very low depending on your credit situation is

Lack of accountability and competence throughout the entire process from the loan officer and loan processor .  As a retired, disabled veteran I chose Penfed due to their low interest rates on home loans.  Mistake.  The loan took over 45 days to close and we didn’t receive the loan final disclosure until two days before closing.  My wife caught a mistake in the final disclosure that failed to account for $5k in seller’s cash to us.  Huge mistake by Penfed. Luckily, our realtor was experienced and was able to amend our contract with the seller within 24 hours.  AVOID CREDIT UNIONS FOR YOUR MORTGAGE NEEDS.  ESPECIALLY PENFED.

I searched online for some personal loans. I just needed about 10 to 15k to complete a transaction a few weeks earlier than needed. The advertisement said approval in 48 hours. Perfect! Or so I thought...  I applied, provided 100% of the requested docs requested within 15 minutes of the application. Then didn't hear from them for days. No emails, no calls. I call them and no one could help me. It's been 2 weeks now. The funds are no longer needed. And the best part is, the hard inquiry will remain on my credit! :) The overall communication process is garbage. I'm a high FICO, High-Income borrower with low debt to income ratio. I would have repaid this loan within a few months at most. They must have too much business on their hands! I won't be applying for any loans from them again. If you want an EASY loan such as a non-collateral personal loan that should be a very fast approval and communication process, DO NOT use Penfed. They turn something "fast and simple" into, "never mind, this taking forever".

If a mistake is made on any application, by either the client or the associate it will be very hard and time consuming to fix. The associate doesn't have the knowledge nor the authority to resolve minor issues in most cases.

PenFed approved me for a $6,000 credit limit 54 weeks after my Chapter 13 discharge, not only my highest credit limit card, but also the one with the highest rewards for both Groceries and Gasoline.  I'm a happy camper.

First opened the account because their saving's rate was one of the highest, but now that no one has any decent rate decided to close it Their bad side, and is a BIG one is their website on-line sinning which is one of the worst for on line banking or savings, sometimes taking several minutes to actually get into you account. It is actually like safe-cracking a vault.
Great card, the entire credit Union offers loans at great savings to me. Always recommend to all my friends. I recently paid off an installment loan and ready to get another one.

Your commercials are insulting to those that Served. You make light of Service and Service members. Your paratroopers, obstacle course Soldiers, are all parodies and represent Service members in a negative light. Your commercial with the Air Force Colonel shows him in a grossly improper uniform and attire. You've had commercials with Service members with goatees, and gross appearance over the year. It is patently obvious you have no individuals with military experience on your marketing staff. Please stop making these commercials that 1) improperly present Service members in uniform, and 2) attempts to make humor of the situations Service members are in. I continue and will continue to avoid your business as long as you run these ridiculous commercials.

Worst company to deal with! You will keep calling and calling and nothing gets handled even in the slightest appropriate amount of time. I needed a document emailed to me and I’m going on the third week of trying to get it done and they keep telling me they submitted a request and I’ll have it in the next 48 hours. If that was the case I would have gotten the document 5 times by now. Even setting up the refinance took a lot, I should have known at that point and backed out. Think twice!

This was my worst experience getting a mortgage, or any loan for that matter. It has been an absolute nightmare.  I have made 27 calls to my loan officer and loan processor and they have picked up the phone thrice: twice when my loan officer were still trying to get me to agree to getting my mortgage through them and once after I emailed my complaints to their resolution lines, more on that later. I have also emailed them a total of 32 emails and got 4 email responses.  I have 800+ credit. I put down 20%. The house value is 2x my annual income. The house appraised for higher than the asking price. So it should be one of the most straight-forward application.  I have always provided requested documents a few hours after they were asked. PenFed has never needed to wait for me for more than 12 hours for anything. I have always been prompt in my communication.  I would save you time here and advise you to not go with PenFed unless you would like to take a chance at not being able to meet contract deadlines, or love to take on some emotional stress.  I have emailed their MortgageResolution@PenFed and Comments@PenFed twice for help for help but that didn't help. So I'm not sure what else could be done here.  Feb 26th, initial loan application signed through the loan portal.  Mar 9th, appraisal paid.  Mar 10th, loan processor assigned. Sent an email to her to introduce myself. No response.  Mar 17th, loan officer asked for the seller's agent phone number. I responded.  Mar 25th, since I have never heard from my loan processor, I emailed MortgageResolution and Comments for help.  Mar 26th, loan officer emailed me asking for the seller's agent phone number(!) I told her we had been through this 9 days ago.  Mar 26th, I heard from the loan processor for the first time, 16 days after she was assigned to my case. I promptly provided documents while we were on the phone.  Mar 30th, I was Conditionally Approved. I promptly provided additional documents.  Apr 1st, I called my loan processor and asked whether we would be able to meet the Mortgage Contingency deadline. I was told that would depend on the appraisal and the title check. Okay... Had the appraisal been scheduled as soon as I paid for it (3 weeks ago at that point), may be those would have been done by that point.  Apr 5th, I received the appraisal report. I emailed and called my loan officer and loan processor to ask for a status update. No response.  Apr 8th, I called the person what responded to me when I emailed MortgageResolution and Comments back on Mar 25th. No response.  Apr 9th, I emailed MortgageResolution and Comments again asking for help. A person replied to me saying that they would provide me with an update the next business day (Apr 12th).  Here we are, on the evening of Apr 12th, I have not received any email or phone call today. My Mortgage Contingency date is Apr 15th.

Bait & Switch. Got approval letter for 7.49 percent. Applied for the card and then was offered 15.49 percent. FICO in low 800's. They offered to withdraw my application and now my credit is dinged. Gee thanks!

Writing this because a close family member is too nice, but PenFed doesn't deserve it.  PenFed won't correct the refinanced car loan to reflect the correct address to get a person off of it who requested it.  Now that person won't sign because of it. After trying to correct it with PenFed AND the company they're the middleman for with for the loan 4 TIMES, they STILL haven't corrected it and claim they haven't received it.  Now they're threatening to raise the APR to their highest possible percentage.  They were on track to pay it off 3 years ahead of time too before this.  Now they'll have to sell the car when the APR goes up.  DO NOT go through them.  They entice you with amazing rates, then cut off contact and either through incompetence or mismanagement, refuse to correct their mistakes.
2 percent cash back on everything! You can’t go wrong with this card! Highly recommend it to everyone! No annual fee, low interest, and easy terms.

My Chapter 13 was discharged a year prior to applying for this card and I was extremely pleased when they approved me for a very nice initial line of credit.  The only annoyance, and a minor one at that, is they reported to the credit bureaus roughly a month before the first due date; had I known they were going to do that I would have paid the card off first.  Now I need to deal with a 14% utilization for the next month.  Like I said, no big deal, the balance on the card will be zero next month and my credit scores will rebound almost immediately.

Horrible. Virtually every step of the credit card application process had to be repeated or their system was not available to perform a transaction.  It actually became comical about how disorganized PenFed is. The last straw was when my first payment on my credit card from my bank did not go through and a PenFed employee had to manually process the payment.  Everything at PenFed was like that.  Too risky to entrust my money with them.
Great card , straight cash back no categories , 2%  great app customer service on top , easy approval high limits. Chances to grow

I have had this account for about 2 months now. Started out with good CL and rate. Today I accidentally did an on line payment and accidentally did $1250 instead of $125. I could mot fix that on the site so I called them. I spoke to a rep that could not help me. She did not care to help me. On Citi you can fix this easily online. I told her I wanted to close the account since the website is not very user friendly. She didn’t care to assist again. But she happily asked if she could not help me with anything else. Is this just me.  If you could not help with two things I asked about. Why would I think she could help with anything else.  Thanks for nothing. I will continue to use citi. Never any problems and higher credit line.

I have banked with PENFED for years so I figured I would do a VA IRRL REFI through them as well . . . BAD DECISION! This is a great starter card !
Great Cash reward card.  No Fee if you have specific accounts with PFCU. You can't beat 5% back on gas either.

well--for 5000 points earned you can get a $50 gift card----BUT--- you need to redeem 5880 points for the card!!   So--thats an 18% (17.6) charge!!. My husband and I were offered to become a part of PenFed Credit Union due to his past military service. At the time the offer came, we were living in a foreign country and although we had access to traditional (local) banks, we did not quite feel comfortable putting our money in a foreign bank. PenFed was truly our answer to that. The customer service representatives are always quick and helpful to resolve issues. We also enjoy the fact that when we do call customer service, it is a real person and not a computer system. We also get real people when we lose or misplace our card at midnight. The signup process was easy and took less than 5 minutes and we are confident that our money is secure no matter where we are. We really love this bank and do not intend to go anywhere else.

The Pen Fed Platinum Rewards card is a good entry card for those with decent credit. If you have very good credit, you can probably get a card with better interest rates, rewards, and perks, but this is good to get you to that point. The reward bonus on money spent is nice, and the the 5% reward for gas purchases is very nice. If you had this card and used it only for gas purchases I would highly recommend it.

Can't create an account if you're not in a state the bank is in. You comply with legal requirements and they make you jump through more hoops. To get these benefits, you have to wait for PenFed to send you an activation code to the "lounge club" and they only do that on a quarterly basis!  So if you spend $15K by April, that means you'll get nothing until sometime in July - I'm still waiting for mine and it's mid-July.  After spending 45 minutes on the phone with PenFed customer service - I was disconnected!  I strongly recommend NOT getting this card and go with a cash back rewards card.  $15K spent will give you $150 back on a 1% cash rewards - enough for at least 3 lounge visits.  Why go through all the trouble?  Hopefully my mistake will help you make a better decision about what card you choose to get.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Visa Signature has some nice rewards features.  I like the better rewards for common purchases like gas and groceries, although that means that big, one-time purchases like plane tickets or appliances won't be earning maximum rewards.  I also prefer rewards programs that just offer simple cash back instead of points to be redeemed, even if they can be redeemed for something like a Visa gift card (which is basically cash).  Rates and fees are sort of standard stuff for this card, but what really stands out to me as positive is that there's no Foreign Transaction Fee.  I have a USAA World Mastercard and do a lot of traveling and the foreign transaction fee kills me.  I've seen as high as 3% on some cards, so 0% with the PenFed Platinum Rewards is great.  Overall this card has some positives and negatives, but I wish the rewards program was structured a little differently--that would make it great.

We have always used Pentagon Federal for our auto loans. Their rates have been consistently some of the best available. The application process is super-quick, and the approval come in no time at all. There have a been a couple of times when the value of the car was such that we were unable to get a loan through them, but they were quick to present other options and let us know the best way to move forward with our purchase. We are happy customers, and I would recommend PenFed for all your auto credit needs.

I love Penfed! I was the victim of a severe identity theft a couple of years ago with all of my personal info sold to criminals across the world, and as a result every bank account I've had since then has been hacked...except at Penfed! I feel my money is safe here. Their customer service reps are extremely friendly and helpful and are on top of their game. I trust them 100%. Highly recommended.

This is a great credit card for rewards on gas and supermarkets. While there are other cards like the Chase Freedom that reward these categories, they do not last all year long like the PenFed card. The APR is high, but that is why with reward cards one should always pay off the entire balance. What would help sell this card is 0 APR for at least 12 months. This card does come without an annual fee though which is very nice. Honestly if you're looking for credit card to reward your gas and supermarket habits look no further. This card is just oozing with benefits and low fees (except the apr).

I love this card! You earn a decent amount of points that can be used for other purchases. There's a great balance transfer rate of 2.99% for 12 months right now, and that's pretty low. However I have a Discover IT card that recently offered me 0% interest on balance transfers for 18 months. There's no cash advance fee, and the interest rates on cash advances are somewhat low. This Penfed card is a great for someone who wants to use a credit card to accumulate points and get gift cards or other benefits from trading in their points.

I have been a member of Pentagon Federal Credit Union since 2011. I have received excellent customer service with them for my checking account. I am not a member of the Armed Services but was able to open an account through my employer. Opening the account was very easy and all of the questions were answered appropriately. The only issued I’ve encountered was not being able to secure financing for a car through Pentagon Federal Credit Union. It probably had more to do with me and the kind of vehicle I was looking for than it did with their financing products.

I love the Pentagon Federal Credit Union. It's open to service members and immediate family of service members. Over the years I've used them, I've had nothing but good experiences with them,  They are very friendly in setting up your account, and explaining all the different features and services available to you. I've gone through them for Checking, Credit Cards, and even a car loan and it's been a lovely experience each time. Low interest rates, no hidden fees, they're transparent about everything, and it just shows that they care about their customer.  If you are able to get into this credit union, don't even think about trying out a big bank, this is the best credit union you'll ever find.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Visa Signature Card is good if you like to travel. You can earn points on purchases. You earn five points on gas purchases, three points on supermarket purchases, and one on everything else that is nice if you travel a lot. They have a nice grace period. The APR is kind of high, but there are ones that are much higher. Also if you have a balnce to transfer you APR gets dropped low on that so it would be best if you have a balance to transfer onto this card. YOu also get a lot of other travel benefits with this card. If you travel this is not a bad card.

I have had this Credit Union for several years now. They offer great rewards for those who qualify. If you have an American Express Black Card they have amazing deals on travel packages etc. The security of my account is top notch, at times it can be almost to much. I have to go through a lot to access my account and if I don't remember the pin, I have to go through a lot to gain access to that also. The customer service is excellent. Every time I have had an issue and had to call in they have always been very helpful. If you are looking for top notch security with great customer service, this is definitely the way to go.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Visa Signature Credit Card is a above average card for those with above average credit. The interest rate is great, and the rewards program is good, although it could be better. 1% rewards on all purchases is nothing to celebrate, but 3% rewards on supermarket purchases could be very useful, especially to those who spend a lot of money on food. 5% rewards on gas sounds great, but you could easily achieve greater rewards by applying for a card directly from a gas station (e.g. a Valaros Credit Card).

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit card offers a lot of perks and benefits for cardholders who want to earn rewards for using the card. Not only do you earn 1 point per dollar spent on all purchases, but you earn even more on gas and supermarket purchases. As an added benefit, cardholders have access to premier golf benefits which is something that’s not offered with the Citi Thank You Preferred card. One thing that I don't like about this card is the 9.99% regular rate. A lower rate on such an incredible card would be nice.

PenFed's rewards program is mediocre at best. Sure, you earn a ton of points for gas and groceries. But when you want to redeem them, PenFed turns around and devalues your earned points at its whim. You no longer can redeem the points at 100:1 rate like one would expect.

This is a military credit union, but I, a civilian, was able to join them by donating a small one time fee to a military campaign to support military families. I think the fee was about $15, and this allowed my husband to open up his own account to apply for loans, etc too. Penfed has the LOWEST interest rates that you will ever find, and their customer service is outstanding! I only gave them 4 stars, due to a paperwork mix up when my husband switched our names and titles on my vehicle. It got all straightened out, and that one time convenience is really nothing compared to the THOUSANDS in interest that we have saved with them over the years.

They work with you on a personal level and make it a delight to do any banking. Good interest rates, no fees, and impeccable customer service make for the perfect credit union if you're eligible.

This card is very good.

Compare this to a card like the Capital One Journey where the interest rate is twice as much, no rewards points, and higher fees for things like Cash Advances.  If your credit is good enough for this card, don't hesitate. You won't do much better.

You can earn points for many things that are part of daily routine - for example, you earn 5 points per $1 spent on gas purchases. For me, it takes nearly $40 to fill up a full tank so that's about 200 points! I also like that the intro APR rate is 4.99% for the first 2 years.
