There's no annual fee which is very appealing and low transfer APR rates. This card reminds me of the New York & Company store card because theres so many points for your spending and then you get rewards except this card is used for overall spending. I would definitely recommend this to those with big families.

Compared to the HSBC platinum card I appreciate  the lower APR of the PenFed Platinum Rewards Visa Signature® Credit Card and the 25 day grace period. Also the lack of Foreign transactions fees is a big plus when I go on trips!

If I had this card it would be the only one i'd use! I use Chase and Citi credit cards paying them in full and rotating them based on the quarterly 5% categories. With this set 5% and 3% on gas and grocery's there is no need to rotate cards. The interest rates are lower than my current cards as well, however, I make sure to spend only what I can actually afford. The Chase and Citi cards did offer a bonus for initial purchases. However, the long term benefits out weighs it by far!

I have been using a Pentagon FCU Visa for years and they offer more cash back then any card I've compared it to.  I get 5% on gas purchases, 2% on groceries, and 1% on everything else.  Now you have to go to cash out the rewards but they offer Amazon instant gift cards, VISA prepaid cards, or other options.  Also, they notice irregular spending instantly and block further use of the card until a card holder calls to unlock the account.  Before traveling, you can go online and notify them of future vacations so they are aware of the card being used in new locations and you won't have to go through the hassle of being declined.  Very good card.  Very good service.

The 4.9% rate on balance transfers is higher than many cards I've seen.  Though the cards that offer 0% interest rates on balance transfers usually only give that rate for the first 12 months, 4.9% only looks good until you see that the current rate on transfers is based on the prime rate which is actually 13.99%, and if you don't pay attention you might miss the initial 3% fee for a balance transfer.  This could be a bit confusing when looking at the 9.99 variable rate the card normally charges.  The maximum penalty being 17.99% for this card is something to consider if you are one who tends to miss payments.  I've seen cards with max penalties as high as 29.99%.  Additionally, the $25 late fee is lower than many cards, which can be as high as $35-40 per late payment.  The reward points are typical of reward-point oriented cards.

I opened a PenFed savings account after I was approved for their Platinum Cash Rewards Visa. I already had a checking account with them so now all of my stuff is pretty much in one place. This is my only credit card other than the debit card. The process was simple. The only bad part is that the credit union is out of state. I can't go into the branch to make a deposit. My husband is a member so I joined too but it is a bit inconvenient. We have to transfer funds from our local account to the new savings account.

I recently opened up a savings account with PenFed (after going through a hoop or two via donations). The account is fairly basic and the APY is pretty standard when compared to other branches, but there are tons of neat features that come with the account. For example, there's a savings calculator and tracker that updates every time you transfer money into your saving account, so you'll always know how close you are to a financial goal. There are also various materials that you can read to help you better understand their savings accounts and other features, which is pretty nice as well.

I would recommend Pentagon Federal credit union. They aren't local, but they are amazing. They are willing to lend large amounts of money, and you don't have to jump through a million hoops. It is a little more difficult to get in, but when you do they treat you right. 1.99% or less for car loans. I have been very happy with them.

I have been a member of Pentagon Federal Credit Union for many years, going back to my time as a service member in the United States Army. Pentagon has always been a true joy to work with. The customer service you receive from them is wonderful and I assume that their problem resolution is wonderful as well. Of course, I cannot say that for certain because I have never had a problem with Pentagon! Their rates on loans, especially vehicle loans are among the lowest that you can find anywhere and their website is incredibly user friendly, so applying for a loan with them couldn't be easier. I can not say enough good things about these guys!

Use Penfed for their gas credit card.  It gives you 5% cash back for all gas purchases, no exceptions.  Without a doubt the best gas card period.  You have to jump through a few hoops to get this card- membership requires DOD employment or being in an affiliate organization.  Also, they are crazy about credit approval.  Expect to have to fax mortgage statements and bank statements and paystubs to them, several times.  Still, hoops are worth it for the nation's best credit card.

This card seems okay. I'm surprised they don't have a initial points offer. Rewards cards are getting very competitive and it's hard to believe it's not offered. Points seem pretty straight forward with a somewhat reasonable regular interest rate, they do have a very nice 0% APR intro rate for 18 months for balance transfers. This is attractive. Though no other intro rate which seems odd like the no initial points offer. The Complimentary 24/7 Concierge Service is nice if you use that sort of thing. They have some other benefits, but I don't see anything I would use that often honestly.

The PenFed Platinum Reward card is very enticing.  The 9.99% interest rate is pretty good as well as the 0% for balance transfers for 18 months.  The cash advance rate is equal to the regular rate which is uncommon in cards, but a great feature.  Who wants to pay more for a cash advance than a purchase?  My only problem with this card is the rewards system.  I typically hate point rewards and much prefer cash rewards like my BoA rewards card.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Card has some really great perks that distinguish it from other credit card companies.  While they don't offer a special intro apr, their standard rate of 9.99% is very reasonable.  I love that they offer higher bonus points on gas purchases, as gas has become very expensive.  It is great that they offer rewards on the things that people buy most often.

This card is similar to a few other cards that come to mind( Bank of America Rewards Card) that offer high points on gas purchases. I used to drive a truck for work and The PenFed Rewards Card would have really come in handy then. The 9.99% APR on cash advances isnt bad either. I would recommend this card to friends and family.

A lot of store cards for gas stations have very limited rewards and huge fees and interest rates. Besides that, they can only be used for that company's gas. The PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card is ideal for those of us who are sick of getting almost nothing out of our gas cards. Five points per dollar spent on gas is the highest I've ever seen and doesn't limit you to only one gasoline company. Even more beneficial than that, you can use this card wherever you want! It is on the Visa network so it can be used in plenty of places. Besides the gas rewards, three points per dollar on groceries is also incredible! Use this card for things you'll always have to spend money on anyway- gas, groceries, and so on, and make some money back in the process with the excellent rewards!

Receive 5 points per dollar on gas purchases with no annual fee? Yes please! This is definitely one of the highest rewards for gas purchases I’ve seen, while still giving a decent amount of points for groceries – two of my most basic and consistent purchases.

My husband and I needed to save our money we made from selling the house into a reliable, safe, and secure bank. We had gotten quite discouraged by the banks out there and decided to try a credit union instead. Since we were living in the Washington, DC area at the time, we tried Pentagon Federal CU.  First off, extremely easy to make an account online. I have never stepped foot inside of their credit union, but that is fine by them as their online presence is fabulous!  Second, when we had to deposit some money, and were no where near a Pentagon Federal Credit Union, they offer a great network of other credit unions. We were able to deposit the check and it was switched into our account that day!  Third, while rates do change all the time, these guys are a leader in great rates for savers.  And lastly, we had the ability because of their very fine credit union, to transfer money out without a cost to other banks when needed. Overall, this bank is one of the best based on customer service, available accounts, and online banking. They deserve every one of those stars.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards card does what many users are looking for, with a well hit balance between rewards and solid APR. If you can qualify for this card I highly recommend it, especially if you are interested in using a credit card for regular necessities like gas and grocery shopping. The rewards will make it very worthwhile and the introductory fee is a great kick start to letting you use the card without overpaying.

I really like the Penfed Platinum Rewards card. You do need decent credit to qualify but the card is definitely worth it. Compared to most credit cards with high qualifications the interest rate is a little high at 10 percent but only slightly higher. My Bank of America Premium card is 8.5 percent but the Penfed is still a better card. Even the best cards out there have a horribly high cash advance rate usually around 25 percent but the Penfed credit card is a low 10 percent. It also has a great rewards system. 5 points at gas stations, 3 points a every major super market and a point for everything else. All this with no yearly fee and that little bit of extra interest is looking pretty good. In my book this is a great card if you can get it.

About 10 years ago while stationed at Kadena Air Base in Okinawa, Japan I got really fed up with BoA due to their crazy ATM fees. Luckily for me, there was a Pen Fed on base that I promptly switched to. I have since, never looked back. The best thing about Pen Fed is their customer service, any problem that I had was promptly expressed and almost every situation was ratified in a short amount of time. One prime example of this was in 2006, I was stationed in England and needed money quickly to put down a deposit and first months rent on a flat (over $3,000 bucks!) The bank on base (ran by BoA non the less) was going to charge me over $200 in conversion rates and said that the money transfer would take 5 days once I received it. After a short phone call to Pen Fed, I was instructed to go to a bank of base that dealt strictly in pounds and I had my money that day!

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card is an excellent option for individuals who are looking to transfer a balance from another card.  The card offers a low rate (4.99%) for transfers made in the last three months of 2013 (although the rate will return to the regular market percentage after the promotional period).  The PenFed Platinum Card offers a lower late fee ($25) and a longer grace period (25 days) than the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card ($35 and 21, respectively) which is an added benefit.  I like the fact that PenFed also gives its cardholders tickets to special events as well as 24/7 complimentary concierge service which is definitely a unique bonus.  The holiday shopping season is almost upon us so The PenFed Credit Card is a good way to consolidate your balance before you splurge on Christmas gifts.

This card is a lot like my Bank of America card in that you will get the largest return on gas and at the supermarket. I really like the point system compared to my cash back program because I feel like I can get more out of it. Another notable plus with the  PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card is there is no annual fee. All in all it looks like a good card. The interest rate is comparable to the card i currently hold and the cash advance interest rate is very reasonable. My favorite thing since I am close to Canada is there is no foreign transaction fees. The special savings and discounts from top retailers sounds about the same as my Bank of America card but unlike my Bank of America card I am not offered golf benefits, sporting events, and complimentary wine tastings. That, I think, is a really nice feature especially since there is no annual fee.

This PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card seems like a very good credit card to have.Unlike the American Express Premier Rewards Gold Card this card offers no annual fee and with the PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card you have the Travel accident insurance and roadside dispatch.This card will be a better choice for someone with very good credit than the American Express card mentioned.The rewards for this card will really make this a card that you could really save a lot of money at retailers and it is very cool that they do not charge you a fee if you use it in other countries which is very valuable to someone who travels outside of the United States very often.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card seems to have some run of the mill rewards, it doesn’t seem to have any pizzazz and it doesn’t seem to have any huge reward redemption deals for travel, so this probably isn’t the card of choice for the world traveler (unlike an American Express credit card). However, this is a good card for everyday uses; with rewards of 3 points per dollar on grocery purchases and 5 points per dollar on gas purchases, those can really add up – great for home life. This card also has a lower regular rate of 9.99%, one of the lower rates I’ve seen on a credit card in a while. I also especially love the 24/7 concierge service, that is really a plus. It’s nice to know you can call and talk to someone at any time of day if you have questions; people take services like that for granted.

The PenFed Platinum card is a good credit card overall. The interest rate of 10 percent is better than most but the point system is mediocre compared to some. You would have to spend 1200 dollars at a supermarket to earn a 25 dollar Gap card. (https://www.penfedplatinumrewards.com) My Chase card earns the same amount of points as this one but they're worth more in real dollars. However one great thing about the PenFed Platinum card is the low cash advance rate, 10 percent is a great offer and better than any other card I've seen. Altogether if you want  low interest rates but don't care too much about a rewards system then this a great card for you.

The terms for this decent. PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card is very competitive in comparing to other credit cards. They offer you really good rewards. Though some may thing it's a little complicated to understand, but if you sit there and just go over the terms you'll understand it pretty easily. It's a really good card to use in such times as we're in and will definitely help the lower class. I like what they're giving though there are better cards out there, but this one is definitely not off the recommended list. The rates are a little high but they can be dealt with. But with this you'll be able to do basic household needs and other basic stuff without worries.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card is a competitive compared to other credit cards in the same category.  They have a decent balance transfer rate although I have seen some as low as zero percent for 18 months.  They have a good rewards point system which allows members to earn money at common places like the grocery store and gas station.  They do not charge an annual fee but do require an excellent credit score to apply.  This fact may limit their customer base in light of the current economic times. Overall,  I do like what they are offering.  However, with a little research, I feel that there are better offers out there.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card is by far one of the best credit card offers I have personally seen in a while when it comes to offering reward points.  I am currently a holder of a Capital One Journey Student Rewards Credit Card.  While they offer 1% cash back on all purchases, the PenFed Platinum card gives you the opportunity to earn more on everyday purchases such as groceries and gas.  With the PenFed credit card, you can earn 3 points per dollar spent on supermarket purchases and 5 points per dollar spent on gas purchases.  Considering everybody needs food and gas, this is a rather generous offer.      The only drawback I can see to this card is the fact that one needs ‘excellent’ credit in order to qualify.  My credit is nowhere near excellent, and therefore I would never even attempt to apply for this card.  It wouldn't be worth the risk to have my credit hit with an inquiry when I know I’ll be denied.  If I had excellent credit, I would absolutely apply for this card.  I believe the introductory rate of 9.9% is rather decent considering some now a days, even with excellent credit, want more than 11%.  Overall, if you have the excellent credit needed in order to be approved for this card, I would go with the offer.   If you can pay it off every month and use it on everyday household items such as groceries, the benefits will be worth it.

I was looking to refinance my car loan and after searching online found that Pentagon Federal Credit Union had one of the best rates I could find. I was able to refinance from 5.9% to 1.49%. Not only was it great to save some money but the application and refinance process was so easy! I was able to do everything online and called in to confirm my application was received. The customer service agent on the phone was incredibly helpful and within a couple days the whole process was done. I had no idea it would be this easy. I would highly recommend them if you are looking for a car loan.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card seems like a complicated card to own. All the different point tiers for different places may be a little hard to remember what place gives what amount of points. There are plenty of cards out there that offer a better introductory rate also, 4.99% is kinda high. You also have to have an excellent credit rating also. I have the Citi Simplicity Credit Card which is like the complete opposite. There are no late fees, no overdraft fees, and no annual fees. I don't have to deal with all the point stuff either. Just use the card and pay the bill. I do like to keep things simple. I'll stick with my Citi Credit Card. The PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card is not for me.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card has some really great spending categories with bonus rewards which I love.  5% back on gas is pretty huge, you don't usually see other cards offer this much back on gasoline purchases, even gas stations store cards.  3% back on grocery stores is also huge, which is better than other grocery store cards like those from Kroger.  And with 1% back on everything else it's still pretty decent and in line with what other cards offer.  Use this card for your groceries and gas, and something else like the VentureOne card for everything else to get a little extra cash back.

I have one of PenFed's reward credit cards which gets me 5% cash back on gas purchases. It's a great card to have in my wallet. I was worried that I wouldn't be eligible for membership in PenFed, but I paid $15 and joined Voices for America's Troops to become eligible. It's an organization open to anyone who supports the military and membership allows you to become eligible for PenFed's great products and services.

This really is a great card!  The PenFed Platinum Rewards card has everything that a customer seeking rewards would be looking for.  You receive 5 points per dollar spent on gasoline, 3 points per dollar spent on groceries and 1 point per dollar on any other type of purchase.  If you pay your credit card balances in full monthly, this could be very beneficial as you'd avoid any type of interest charge and easily be able to accrue over 1,000 points per month.  To top all this off is a great 10% APR for the introductory rate, if you were to carry a balance.  You'd be hard pressed to find another card that offers this much with as little of a risk!

Now this is a rewards card I can get behind. The PenFed Platinum Rewards.  The categories I spend the most money on is gas and groceries.  This card offers 5% back on gasoline, 3% back on groceries, and 1% back on everything else.  On top of all that they do not charge an annual fee.  You could definitely use this card for your gas and your groceries, and use another credit card to get more than the standard 1% back everywhere else.  For example, Capital One Venture offers 1.25% back on every day purchases.  This is definitely a good card to have in your wallet, and if it offered more than 1% back on every day purchases I would give it 5 stars.

This PenFed Platinum Rewards credit card is pretty great. The 5 points for gas and 3 points for groceries makes it very attractive. However, these points sometimes don't convert 1:1 for cash. Sometimes you need more than one point per dollar, and that's where this card loses to other cards such as the AmEx Blue Cash cards, or the Discover IT card that has currently has 5% cashback on gas. Otherwise, the rate is not bad at all for this card. It's pretty nice for a credit card, that's for sure. I would not personally recommend it, since there are better cards out there.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards card is a fantastic card. If you can get approved for it, that is. You need top notch credit to get this one, but if you can it's a great credit card to have. The rewards are pretty good, the intro APR is I believe a little over 9%, which is great in my book. For being a member you get access to a 24/7 concierge and other exclusive benefits only available to cardholders. Usually, cards with these types of benefits have a very high annual fee, but not the PenFed Platinum Rewards card. No outrageous fee's of any kind.

Woah! The PenFed Platinum Rewards Credit Card offers some of the best cash back rewards I've seen! 5% on gasoline is ridiculous, even higher than the well-known and touted TrueEarnings Credit Card from Costco and American Express. The return on groceries is great too, better than other cards I've seen. And of course, the 1% return on everything else you purchase is an industry standard for rewards cards. And it has no annual fee, AND a low interest rate of 9.99%? This is definitely the card to get - it may not be easily attained, but the rewards for this card truly outshine any other card I've seen.

The PenFed Platinum Rewards credit card is a great offer that you shouldn’t pass up! This card has one of the best reward programs that I’ve seen, with huge rewards such as 5% back on gas purchases! The interest rate of 9.99% is also fairly low for a rewards credit card. Although you need excellent credit to get this card, I believe that it is very worth it when you are able to get it. I long grace period and relatively low late fee are also comparable to other rewards cards. Try and apply for this card even if you don’t think you have the credit!

Last year, I was searching for a loan company to take over the lease on my 2010 Hyundai; most of the companies offered rates with APRs over 3.0%, which seemed a bit high in my opinion, but I was running out of options. That was, of course, until I stumbled upon PenFed's website, which at the time was offering a 1.99% APR on lease transfers. I was blown away by the rate, but figured there must be some kind of catch. I did a ton of research online into PenFed, the kind of company they were, and customers' experiences with them in the past. Overall, people seem very pleased with the service they've received, so I went ahead with the loan, and have not looked back since. Not only is their customer service OUTSTANDING (I placed NUMEROUS calls during the loan process as it was my first time out the gate with this sort of thing, and I required a lot of hand-holding), but they were extremely patient with some of the delays on Hyundai's end in getting the title transferred over. All in all, a seamless experience, got my loan quick as a flash, and am paying it off on a monthly basis at a rate that far bests those of their competitors.

I heard about this credit union about two years ago while watching the news one morning. Recently, I've been looking around my area for a CU that could offer me a competitive rate for a loan for a car, and PenFed met my needs. I even double checked other institutions to ensure that they were indeed giving me the best rate, and they surely were. They assisted me in the process of making a loan for the car and explained everything about the terms of the loan in great detail. I've interacted with the phone customer service a number of times in the past two weeks I've been with PenFed, and they're more than willing to assist me and answer any questions I may have. Their website is also easily navigable, so I'm also able to look up info on their site if I need to. I'm loving my experience thus far, and I hope to be with these guys for quite some time.

I chose the PenFed Promise Card because of its incredibly low interest rate and long interest-free promotion period. I agree with other users, the most difficult part was figuring out whether or not I was even eligible to be a member, but I made a one-time donation to the Military Family Foundation and was eligible. I´ve had it for about 5 years now and can´t complain too much. I have had a few instances where I am overseas and the account is blocked for suspicious activity, but I actually don´t mind that at all, since it shows they´re on top of things. Sometimes getting the block lifted on the phone can be a bit of a pain though, and involves speaking to several reps.

We have been members of the Pentagon Federal Credit Union for over a decade. We have opened and paid off two auto loans with them in that time and are in the process of our third. They have a wonderful car buying service online which allows users to get lower rates than walking in to a dealership. This also provides special incentives (some offer $500 off, etc.). The customer service at PenFed has always been great. The interest rates are competitive, and the process of obtaining a loan is seamless. If pre-approved, you are given a check to take straight to the dealership. I highly recommend this credit union.

I can get this out of the way right now: the worst thing about PenFED is the application process. It’s very confusing at first to find if you are eligible for enrollment or not in any of their services. Here is the story. I was looking into home mortgages a while back, and an old family friend recommended PenFED. However, looking online you would think that they were only for military personnel/families, right? Wrong. Any state/federal employee is also eligible for PenFED’s services. Well, they did not have the best rate at the time for the home loan (local credit union around me beat them out), but I noticed that they did have one of the best interest rates still out there when it came to savings. So my wife (who is a teacher) got us an account and we started our first joint savings account with these fine folks.

PenFed rates are excellent, but this is another case of “you get what you pay for”. I recently did a re-fi with them because of their awesome promotions and rates, but their customer service people must be inundated with workload. You have to stay on their representatives like on a person with severe ADHD.  Also, don’t forget to watch for typographical mistakes. Furthermore, it is nearly impossible to get any kind of written reassurance that you qualify for the promotions they mention. It is an uphill battle to get things done with them, but well worth the effort in the end, just keep your eye on the prize.

I have obtained 3 car loans from PenFed, and I have nothing but good things to say about their service. They offer exceptional products with low interest rates and always take care of their customers. Their phone reps are professional, friendly, and helpful. The application process is easy. You can either do it online or over the phone. Once the application is submitted, a package with clear and precise instructions is sent out. Their customer service department is very helpful with questions and instructions regarding the loan application process.  My last experience obtaining a car loan with PenFed was a little on the slow side, but it was mostly caused by the low interest rates they were offering. They were inundated with hundreds of loans they were processing, so it took them a little bit longer to fully approve my loan. But other than that, I have always had pleasant experiences with this company. I would highly recommend them to friends and family.

My father is an employee of Pentagon Federal Credit Union and has been my entire life. I have had a savings account at PFCU since I was young and now that I'm 25 it has accrued a good amount of interest and is still there for me whenever I need it.  Now that I'm on my own, I'm going to open a checking account with PFCU as well. Having a savings account through them has helped me learn how to save and have my extras for my hard work. The employees are also incredibly nice and helpful; every question I've very had has been answered and more. I would recommend PFCU to anyone.

I was a member prior to graduating from college and joining the military. I have been an active member of Pentagon Federal Credit Union since 1989. When I was on active duty, the banking services were fantastic; regardless of where I traveled or was stationed, I never had to worry about cashing a check from my checking account at another institution, ATM access, etc. (this was during a time period where some systems were incompatible with each other). This was a great comfort in both Europe and Asia. Everything worked smoothly and seamlessly.  I've used their mortgage and car loan services as well; my house is currently financed with a consolidated VA loan from Pentagon Federal and my last new car was also financed by them. For the most part, their rates can't be beat! However, I have been disappointed by their sharp decline in customer service skills for all services across the board. Confirmation and approval seem to take a bit longer than most places, and it can be hard getting correct information about the state of the loan process on the phone. Also, although there are mobile apps for banking, Pentagon Federal does not seem to advertise these and other conveniences as strongly as other military affiliated credit unions. The office(s) at my location (Colorado Springs, CO) closed years ago, after changing from a full service credit union office to one that worked car loans and mortgages while providing minimal customer banking services. If you can live with these frustrations, you will find Pentagon Federal's rates and services to be some of the most competitive out there!

I have been with  Pentagon Credit union for a while now for my banking purposes. So far everything has been great. I like how my checks are processed really fast and and no waiting time for me. The customer service is really helpful. I like how I can call about any questions regarding my account and the employees are so very helpful to me. This bank is a great for anyone who is just starting out. I was recommended to this bank by a former class mate who says they were very helpful with school loans. So that's what basically drew me to this bank. So far no bad opinion about this credit union.

My credit union is the Pentagon Federal. I like them over the others I have tried because they always have the best deal for car loans and credit card rebates. They also offer a lot of other really great deals for things like car buying (new and used cars), home mortgage rates, CDs and checking accounts. One thing I just learned they do, and I made use of, is the Penfed Defender American Express card. It gives a whopping 1.5% cash rebate on everything I buy! It's credited directly to the statement each month (automatically too). You need to be an active military or retired military to get the card.

Everything about Pentagon Federal Credit Union is great. The customer service is second to none, the application process was fairly quick and easy, I've never had an unclear disclosure, and the few problems I have had, they've been resolved pretty quickly and painlessly. Although they're my secondary bank/credit union, they very well could be my first choice but because of convenience I cannot have them be my primary bank. But nevertheless, they're great! I've never had any problems ever with them and I don't see any problems coming in the near or distant future. Great service. Great people! Great everything!

I have been a PenFed member for some years now and I have to honestly say that they are really fine people with great deals on all kinds of financial products. I originally just wanted the credit card they offered that gave a 5% rebate on gasoline. I later learned about other deals like car loans at 1.9% and a 3% rebate at grocery stores when using that credit card. They now have two versions of that card, one that pays in points you redeem for giftcards (I like getting the Walmart card). The other card pays you in cash as a credit on your statement. Read the rules carefully before choosing your card. They are different for sure!  PenFed's customer service is fantastic too! They always are kind and polite and offer really helpful suggestions to resolve the issues. It is also a 24/7 service! I never expected that from a credit union!  Joining was a little tricky because I was never in the military, but if you ask the right questions you can join based on where you live. I am some 30 miles from a base, but that was close enough! Ezee-peezie!

I love Pentagon Federal Credit Union. I have banked with them for five years now and have had nothing but positive experiences. I have a savings account with them that I use as my private savings. What I love the most about Pentagon Federal is that their rates are incredibly cheap and their products are beneficial to their customers. My PenFed credit card earns me five percent off all of my gas purchases. In today's economy this helps a lot because gas prices are so high. My fiancée and I are in the process of buying a home and will be using Pentagon as our mortgage lender. I just love the fact that they are fair and not like typical banks that only care about getting as much money as they can from their customers. I also love how easy it is to access my account online and how easy it is to understand it. I have external transfers set up with my other accounts, and online bill pay. I have nothing but positive words for Pentagon Federal and will continue to bank with them.

I have been using the Penfed Points as well as the Penfed Cash cards a while now and I think that this is a winning combo!  I get really nice rebates on both, but the two cards are not exactly the same and so I use them in combination to max the value of the rebates I get from each. Of course Cash is King in this world, so I use the Cash card for the car, that yields me 5% in cash in rebates. As far as the Points card goes, I use that mainly for grocery stores since it is the only card I found that consistently offers a significant rebate for buying grocery items (3%). The Points card however is not a very good deal for anything else. You can redeem your points for gift cards (at face value with no discounts) so I feel that if I really wanted one of those, I would simply go buy a gift card (probably at a grocery store) and get something of a rebate for that purchase!

Pentagon Federal Credit Union is one of the best banking institutions that I have ever been associated with. I am very lucky to be eligible to be a member of this credit union. My father worked at the Pentagon and family members are allowed to join. I started with a basic savings and checking account when I was in my late teens. As I have gotten older, they have provided me with some great deals. When I bought my car, I had almost no credit. They gave me a fair rate of 7.5% interest over 6 years. Three years later, after I had built some credit, I was able to refinance my car loan with them for an unbelievable 1.5% interest payment and only $250 in fees. I am able to make deposits from home as long as I send the check into the bank within a week and use their online bill pay every month. So convenient and easy, I do not think I have even sent a bill by mail in the last two years.

I have been using the Penfed rewards card for years and I have to tell you that this is one of the best deals out there, IF you can get one. They are picky about who gets to be a member. But the rewards are well worth the hassle of going through all the screening: eg. 5% cash rebates on gas and 3% at the grocery store is just the start of the good stuff. Also since you need to open a Penfed "shares" account to get the card, check out all the Penfed Credit Union offers too! Lots of great deals on car loans and other "freebies" for members only! It's all good! It is not just for Federal employees either. You can join  based on how close you are to a military base and/or who in your family was in the military.

I have been a PFCU Member for 6 years and have been very satisfied. My main business with PFCU is via its loan services. I also have a small balance in a share saving account. They have really good rates on auto loans which is why I originally joined. Their rates are really unmatched. Since the initial auto loan, which I paid off, I have also received a personal loan. If you're looking for the best auto loan rates PFCU is hard to beat in my opinion. PFCU has excellent customer service; you can reach a real person 24 hours a day. It's a really easy and ideal credit union for me even though it's out of state. I can make deposits electronically to the savings account and withdraw money without ATM fees.

I’ve had the Pentagon Federal Credit Union Platinum Cash Rewards Credit Card for a few years now.  Might I add that Penfed is a great institution.  I also refinanced a car loan with them with a very low rate.  The rewards for the card used to be better but with recent changes there still is one great benefit.  That benefit is the 5% off gas.  No matter what station you go to as long as you pay at the pump you will receive 5% off of your transaction.  Each billing period the 5% is taken off of your billing statement as a credit.  This card definitely helps with the gas price hikes.

I got a used car loan through Pen Fed, and they were great about the whole process.  My mother worked for the Pentagon, so I was able to get an account with this institution.  The rate was extremely low, 1.9% interest, and the customer service reps helped me through the process.  I was not sure what length of loan I wanted.  Also, I was unclear on exactly how to go about buying a used car with a loan as I had not done this before.  I was able to set up automatic payments through the online banking which has been helpful and convenient.  I recommend this service to anyone looking to buy a used car.

I initially came in contact with Penfed back in 2007 while trying to purchase my first car.  I was denied by various lenders but, they approved me right away with a very low APR and I received the check in the mail within 3 business days.  They are very professional and courteous at all times.  There were even times I had some financial difficulties and they reduced my monthly payment on my car loan.  In addition, they give customers even better options by allowing one skipped payment annually which can be a great help to anyone who knows what it's like to need a break from bills sometimes.  I have never had any issues with them and I would definitely recommend them to anyone in need of a reputable and credible credit union.

Having joined Pentagon Federal Credit Union around six years ago, I have never once had a problem with their service.  While membership is free for members of the armed services and various other government employees, there are other ways that you can meet their eligibility requirements.  I was able to join by making a donation to and joining the National Military Family Association.   Penfed has excellent rates for all types of mortgage related products, including refinancing and new home loans.  They also have extremely competitive rates for car and motorcycle loans.  I personally use their Platinum Cash Back Visa, which provides 5% cash back on fuel, and .25% cash back on everything else.  While the everything else category isn't nearly as good as it used to be, the cash back on gas is still among the best available anywhere.  I would, and do, highly recommend Penfed.

I have been a member of Pentagon Federal Credit Union (PenFed)for about 8 years now and have had nothing but good experiences with them.  To join you have to be a member (or family member) of the the military or a United States government employee.  PenFed is always the first place I look at for any kind of loan, be it car, mortgage, or personal as their rates are always better than any traditional bank.  On that note their car loans (new, used, and refinanced) are some of the lowest in the country. Being a credit union, they also have slightly better checking and saving rates as compared to banks.  There customer service is also great, however they do hold 'ÂÂbanker'ÂÂ hours so it can be hard to get a hold of someone after hours.  Also the application process for membership can be a little tedious as you have to prove your eligibility but that is understandable.  Those however are very minor complaints and I would recommend PenFed to anyone who is eligible if not for anything else but to have access to their loans.

The PenFed Promise card is my safe credit card. There really are absolutely no fees. The card is great for people with credit card debit but that isn’t me. I got this as my first credit card and use it for daily purchases and monthly subscriptions. I choose this card because I’m currently a college student and bound to make a few mistakes. With this card those mistakes won’t cost me even more with outrageous fees. Advantages: no fees at all, great customer service at PenFed, easy approval. Disadvantages: PenFed is restricted to Federal employees and there are no rewards or cash back.

I've been using the Pentagon Federal Credit Union Platinum Cash Rewards Visa for years, and have been extremely satisfied with it.  The cash back is not as good as it used to be, currently offering 5% cash back for pay at the pump gas purchases, and 0.25% for everything else.  While the "everything else" category isn't as good as other cards, the 5% cash back for gas is what keeps me using the card.  On top of that, there are no hoops to jump through for redemption, as your cash back is automatically added as a statement credit to your balance every month.  In order to get this card, you have to join Penfed.  If you don't qualify through government or military service, you can make a $10 donation to charity to become eligible.

PFCU turned their cash back card into a gas cash back credit card. Bad choice! I still use it to buy gas - until I find another one, but for other purchase I use USAA cash back card because I get 1.25% back every month, just like PFCU used to do. Really bad choice PFCU!

You go, PenFed! The Pentagon Federal Credit Union’s got your back these days because as gas prices ae rising to record levels, they have a number of offers with great generic gas rewards. The Pentagon Federal Credit Union Platinum Cash Back Rewards Credit Cards is just one of their offers that gives you 5% on gas no matter where you get it, just as long as you pay at the pump. That’s a pretty sweet deal for anyone who can’t just go to a single gas station every time they need to fill up their tank. That’s of course not all the Pen Fed Platinum Cash Rewards Card offers though. It also gives you 1% cash back on everything else and a 1.99% introductoru balance transfer APR for 24 months. Neither of those last two things is all that great but they are merely supporting actors to the 5% cash back gas rate. You can get comparable rates on other cards, but most are affiliated with specific stations which means you have to get gas there to save and the others offer higher rates for only the first couple months or so. In general, the highest regular cash back rate you’ll get on gas purchases on a non-station affilated card is 3%. That makes the Pentagon Federal Credit Union Cash Back Card unique and extremely beneficial. It is important to note though that to get the PFCU Platinum Cash Back Credit Card you’ll have to join PenFed, which will run you $15. Now, as I mentioned the Platinum Cash Back Rewards Card is not the only rewarding gas credit card Pentagon Federal Credit Union has got. A number of other cards (like the Coast Guard Auxiliary Credit Card) that are branded with the names of military organizations or associations also offer 5% cash back at any gas station as well as 1% on all other purchases and they donate 0.25% of all your purchases to the organization your card is affiliated with. Don’t worry, that dough is coming out of PenFed’s pocket, not yours!

The Coast Guard Auxiliary Credit Card is an example of why credit card comparison is important. When looking for a gas rewards credit card, most people probably focus on offers from the biggest banks that are branded as “gas rewards” cards. However, I recently stumbled upon this Coast Guard branded rewards credit card from the Pentagon Federal Credit Union, which gives users 5% cash back on gas purchases made at the pump (as opposed to paying inside, which would be a curious thing to do, given that you are paying with a credit card). The 5% cash back, which you can earn at any gas station, makes the Coast Guard Auxillary credit card perhaps the most lucrative generic gas rewards card on the market. It even makes it more lucrative than the Exxon Mobil Credit Card and the Citgo Credit Card, which both require that you fill up affiliated stations in order to benefit. The PenFed Coast Guard Card also offers 1% cash back on all other purchases as well as heightened rewards on spending categories other than gas and doesn’t even have an annual fee. You also give back whenever you use this card, as PenFed donates 0.25% of the total amount you spend each month to the Coast Guard Auxiliary Association. So, I would have to say that this card should be a definite consideration for anyone interested in earning gas rewards. Just keep two things in mind. First, this Coast Guard card is only for people with good-to-excellent credit. Second, PenFed is a credit union and membership (which costs only $15) is a condition of opening the card.
